title: Game cooked in an Indian wok (Kadhai ka shikar)
description: This Indian recipe for cooking grouse is heady, aromatic and packed full of flavour. It will also work will other types of game.
ingredients: ¼ tsp carom seeds or ajwain seeds
2 dried red chillies, each broken into 2-3 pieces
700g/1lb 9oz pumpkin flesh, peeled, cut into 1cm/½in cubes
2 tsp dried mango powder (amchoor), available from Indian supermarkets (or mango pickle from a jar)
1 fresh bay leaf or cinnamon leaf
2 medium onions, peeled, 1½ onions finely chopped, remaining ½ onion cut into 1cm/½in slices
2.5cm/1in piece fresh root ginger, peeled, chopped
3 tomatoes, 2 blended to a purée, 1 seeds removed, cut into 1cm/½in slices
6 grouse breasts, bones removed, cut into 1cm/½in strips
few sprigs micro salad leaves or mixed salad leaves, to serve
